narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
comments: Deadlines for projects were sometimes unclear
The course schedule, due dates, and plans for each day were clear throughout the semester. If we were ever unsure if due dates changed, Jen and Schrader promptly clarified.

narratives.question_text: How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: The nature of props construction has somewhat of an improv feel... try something and maybe it will work. So it's hard to prepare for just about everything, and I think that, in itself, was a great learning experience.
I always felt that Jen and Schrader took the time to prepare for each class. I thoroughly enjoyed the demonstrations. It is clear they have a wealth of knowledge.

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?
comments: Instructors are both so knowledgeable about many things. Gave relevant, down to earth information in lecture ("look out for this." Or "I've seen it done that way but it costs more.") Answered every question they were asked.
There was more outside work required then I had expected but I do not think it was too much. It was just different from my expectations

The format of the class was great - the instructors walked around and checked in with everyone, offering customized suggestions. You could also learn from your peers that were doing something slightly different.
The workload varied per project. At times I was caught off guard by how much work was required but we were given access to all of the course materials so i was able to continue working at night.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
comments: This comment has no solution, but it would be more helpful to have the classroom near the prop shop... Maybe next time you build a theater.

I truly appreciated that Jen and Schrader were willing to meet with me to discuss my projects outside of the classroom. They were flexible with their time during work hours and I was able to meet with them when I had time during the day.

narratives.question_text: How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
comments: This class was almost entirely hand on. I wish more of our classes had more hands on elements like this.
I enjoyed the fact that this was a hands on class. I would not have learned nor retained nearly as much if I had not had the chance to experiment and create my own props.

narratives.question_text: If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: Although props is not my main focus, I think having these skills is extremely helpful, even if its just an understanding of how long a process will take.
Useful AND it was such an enjoyable class!

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
comments: Jen knows a lot about mold making. I think there could stand to be an entire mold making course.
They are both brilliant. I could learn from them for years.
Jen and Schrader obviously know A LOT about the course topics and were able to communicate that knowledge clearly.

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: Near the end of the semester the workspace was an absolute mess. It was our own fault. (And we ran out of paint without realizing it, probably because of the disarray.) Maybe enforce some sort of clean-up policy?
I appreciated that Jen and Schrader took the time to explain things that other students took for granted. I thoroughly enjoyed this course and will carry with me what I have learned.
